As soon as an Austrian of- ficer showed himself near a commanding offi- cer's quarters, the regiment began to move: the soldiers ran from the fires, thrust their pipes in- to their boots, their bags into the carts, got their muskets ready, and formed rank. The of- ficers buttoned up their coats, buckled on their swords and pouches, and moved along the ranks shouting. T
